name: crystalline
description: Language Server Protocol implementation for Crystal

repo.name: crystalline
repo.description: A Language Server Protocol implementation for Crystal. 🔮

readme.summary: Clear project description and excellent installation instructions, but lacks practical usage examples and the quick start focuses on editor setup rather than demonstrating actual functionality.
readme.top_issue: No code examples showing what language server features are available or how they work in practice - only editor integration setup instructions

common_complaints: LSP functionality incomplete/broken in some editors (Eglot, Helix)
LSP doesn't work inside uncalled methods
Build/compilation issues with different LLVM versions
praise_themes: Project appreciated and valuable to users
Works well with lsp-mode in Emacs
Core functionality is functional when it works
sentiment.summary: Crystalline has an engaged community with genuine appreciation for the project, but struggles with maintenance responsiveness, critical bugs (memory leaks, unexpected reverts), and incomplete editor support that frustrates active users.

red_flags: repeatedly deferring to other issues or external factors
lack of proactive support for new contributors
communication.summary: The maintainer's responses are generally adequate but show signs of being reactive rather than proactive, which can be discouraging for new contributors.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being from April 2025
22 open issues with no recent activity or resolution
Zero closed issues in past 6 months indicating no maintenance
No merged PRs in past 6 months showing no development activity
No active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release date suggests release infrastructure may be dormant
maintenance.summary: The crystalline package shows clear signs of abandonment with no commits, merged PRs, closed issues, or active contributors in the past 6 months despite 22 unresolved open issues.

project_metrics.description: A Language Server Protocol implementation for Crystal. 🔮

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is generally well-structured and informative, but could benefit from more concise language and clearer configuration instructions.
concerns: No commits in the past six months, indicating a lack of active development.
A high number of open issues (20) suggests potential bugs or feature requests that have not been addressed.
Docs: Lack of clear and concise quick start example to get new users up and running quickly
Communication: repeatedly deferring to other issues or external factors
Communication: lack of proactive support for new contributors
High bus factor risk (92% from top contributor)
highlights: 9 contributors are still active, which could indicate ongoing interest and engagement with the project.
Recent activity in terms of PRs and releases within the past six months.
